Transcription-Unit.comment: A potential RNA G-quadruplex structure, formed by guanine-rich sequences located in the coding sequence region of the gene, was identified for rimK . This structure could regulate the expression of the gene, as observed for hemL gene expression [Shao20].

Evidence-Code.comment: The length of the (transcribed) RNA is experimentally determined. The length of the mRNA is compared with that of the DNA sequence and by this means the number of genes transcribed are established.

Publication.title: Characterization of the gene rimK responsible for the addition of glutamic acid residues to the C-terminus of ribosomal protein S6 in Escherichia coli K12.
Publication.author: Kang WK
Icho T
Isono S
Kitakawa M
Isono K

Promoter.comment: We assigned a putative transcription start site to this promoter based on the observation that the majority of the promoters, whose transcription start sites were determined experimentally, present a distance of 6 nucleotides between the transcription start site and the -10 box.

Evidence-Code.comment: Automated inference. A computer inferred this assertion through one of many possible methods such as sequence similarity, recognized motifs or consensus sequence, etc. When a person made the inference from computational evidence, use EV-COMP-HINF.

Publication.title: Sigma70 promoters in Escherichia coli: specific transcription in dense regions of overlapping promoter-like signals.
Publication.author: Huerta AM
Collado-Vides J

Evidence-Code.comment: A person inferred, or reviewed a computer inference of, promoter position relative to the -10 and -35 boxes.

IMP inferred from mutant phenotype.
The assertion was inferred from a mutant phenotype such as
  • Any gene mutation/knockout
  • Overexpression/ectopic expression of wild-type or mutant genes
  • Anti-sense experiments
  • RNA interference experiments
  • Specific protein inhibitors
  • Complementation

Comment: Inferences made from examining mutations or abnormal levels of only the product(s) of the gene of interest are covered by code EV-IMP (compare to code EV-IGI). Use this code for experiments that use antibodies or other specific inhibitors of RNA or protein activity, even though no gene may be mutated (the rationale is that EV-IMP is used where an abnormal situation prevails in a cell or organism).
